abstract: A WiMax equipment startup, Telsima, announced a new $50 million Series D round of venture funding that will bankroll the company’s expansion plans in India and Eastern Europe. Telsima, which makes WiMax-based broadband wireless access technology, received the money from its initial investor syndicate, which includes NewPath Ventures, New Enterprise Associates, CMEA Ventures, and Intel Capital.
lead_paragraph: A WiMax equipment startup, Telsima, announced a new $50 million Series D round of venture funding that will bankroll the company’s expansion plans in India and Eastern Europe. Telsima, which makes WiMax-based broadband wireless access technology, received the money from its initial investor syndicate, which includes NewPath Ventures, New Enterprise Associates, CMEA Ventures, and Intel Capital.

headline.main: WiMax Start-Up Picks Up $50 Million from V.C.’s
